SECRET.
G.T. 4212
BATTLE SITUATION - 6 p.m. - 12th APRIL, 1918.
1. The enemy made heavy attacks this morning on the front between MERVILLE and PLOEGSTEERT and has made further progress.
We have had to withdraw from HILL 63, North of PLOEGSTEERT, and from MESSINES.
2. Our line from GIVENCHY now runs through FESTUBERT and LOCON to the River BOURRE, just West of MERVILLE, and along that River to les PURESBECQUES, thence to VIEUX BERQUIN. Between VIEUX BERQUIN and BAILLEUL our line has been forced back to just North of the HAZEBROUCK - BAILLEUL Railway. The line then runs from BAILLEUL Station to STEENWERCK Station, thence East of NEUVE-EGLISE and WULVERGHEM to WYTSCHAETE which we hold.
Reserves have reached STRAZEELE, METEREN, and BAILLEUL.
3. No change on the rest of the front.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
12th April, 1918.
Issued at 7.35 p.m.
